intro: Drepananthus filiformis, commonly known as the slender whipstick, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its slender, wiry stems and delicate appearance make it a distinctive member of its ecosystem.
